*With the new aero, proper gravity turns are now possible in stock KSP (YAY!). Now, one-button launches are far more practical than they were before, so I think a revival of the Ã¢â‚¬Å“one-buttonÃ¢â‚¬Â challenge is in order.*

*Inspired by* [*YakkyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s HandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s free challenge*](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/94490-The-Hands-Free-Mission-Challenge) *which in turn was inspired by* [*Thunderous Echo's "One-Button Bill" Challenge*](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/94346-1-Button-Bill)*.*

**Briefing:**

Ever since KerbinÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s dramatic atmosphere transformation, Jeb has not been able to fly our rockets straight. We've built several hundred rockets already and he has crashed every single one of them (itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s quite amazing, really). As a result, we are now almost bankrupt; one more failed launch will put the final nail in the coffin for our space program. ThatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s why we need your help. We need you to build a rocket that requires so little thought to fly that Jeb cannot possibly crash it. We need a rocket that only takes one button to fly.

Interested? Great!

Here are some basic guidelines that you should follow while you build your space craft:

**Rules:**

- Only use one action to fly your space craft: The stage function (the Space bar). There is no limit to how many times you can stage.

- Once launched, you cannot change the throttle.

- No debug menu Ã¢â‚¬Å“cheatsÃ¢â‚¬Â (no infinite fuel, unbreakable joints, etc.)

- Stock only, no mods other than information/visual

- Provide pictures of all the key events in the mission WITH resource tab open.

- (Optional) Provide a craft file with staging time stamps. If your mission is complicated, I may ask you do this just to verify.

There are two categories you can apply for:

 **--- Explorer ---**

**Goal:** Exploring the Kerbin system will never be easier (at least for the pilot)! Your mission is to send a one-man capsule to a stable orbit somewhere in the Kerbin system. (You can take extra, but we only care about the pod)

**Scoring:**

**For Kerbin Orbit:** ----- (semi major axis(in Km) \* (1 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ eccentricity of orbit))

**For Mun Orbit:** -------- 30\*((Mun SOI radius(2230) - semi major axis(in Km)) \* (1 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ eccentricity of orbit))

**For Minmus:** ---------- 60\*((Minmus SOI radius(2187) - semi major axis(in Km)) \* (1 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ eccentricity of orbit))

*(Basically, you get rewarded more points if your orbit is large and circular)*

1.5x multiplier for return trip.

0.9x multiplier for every stage past stage two. (For instance, if you stage four times, your multiplier is 0.9\*0.9 = 0.81)

No points for leaving KerbinÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s SOI.

**Multipliers are accumulative**

**--- Heavy Lifter ---**

**Goal:** How awesome would it be to have a rocket that can deliver payloads to LKO without having to think about piloting it? Your mission is to efficiently deliver a payload to Low Kerbin Orbit using only the space bar. (Fairings are recommended)

**Scoring:**

log<sub>2</sub>(Mass of payload)\*(Mass of payload / (cost of rocket(not including payload)-cost of recovery))
